message.entry: The list of solvers and recommendation are updated based on the specified objective and constraint types
Function to minimize by varying x, given a start point
Function to minimize by varying x
Function to attain the goals specified by varying x, given a start point and a weighting vector
Vector-valued function to find a minimax solution by varying x, given a start point
Vector function describing a system of nonlinear equations to solve, given a start point
Function whose zero is to be computed, given an interval or start point
Vector function whose sum of squares you want to minimize, given a start point and input data
Nonlinear vector function whose sum of squares you want to minimize, given a start point
Function can be selected from file, from local function in the current script, or from function handle workspace variable
Browse to file
Create new function template
Refresh function arguments
Specify the function input to optimize
Workspace variable, specified as a fixed parameter function input
Starting value for x
Interval containing zero of equation or scalar starting value for x
Coefficients of linear objective f'*x
Linear objective f to minimize 1/2*x'*H*x + f'*x
Vector values the objective function attempts to attain
Weighting vector to control the relative underattainment or overattainment of the objectives
Number of variables is the dimension of the objective function
Quadratic objective H to minimize 1/2*x'*H*x + f'*x
Input data for model
Response data for model
Matrix C to solve the linear system C*x = d in the least-squares sense
Vector d to solve the linear system C*x = d in the least-squares sense
Workspace variable, specified as a real vector or real array
Workspace variable, specified as a real vector
Workspace variable, specified as a positive integer
Workspace variable, specified as a symmetric real matrix
Workspace variable, specified as a real matrix
Workspace variable, specified as a vector of positive integers
Workspace variable, specified as a function handle
Workspace variable, specified as a second-order cone constraint
Workspace variable, specified as a real scalar
Workspace variable, specified as a real scalar or a 2-element real vector
Workspace variable containing indices of integer variables or containing an IntegerConstraint object that specifies integer, semi-integer, and semi-continuous variables.
Constraints limit the solution space for x
Lower limits on the solution
Upper limits on the solution
Linear inequalities of the form A*x ≤ b specified by matrix A and vector b
Linear equalities of the form Aeq*x = beq specified by matrix Aeq and vector beq
Nonlinear inequalities of the form c ≤ 0 and nonlinear equalities of the form ceq = 0
Integrality constraints on x
Second-order cone constraints of the form norm(A*x−b) ≤ d'*x−γ for matrix A, vectors b and d, and scalar gamma (γ)
Set all bounds to the same value or select a workspace variable
Specify option category
{0} is this option's name in the documentation table found when clicking the help link

entry.note: Hole 0 is a numeric or char value

message.entry: The default value is {0}
The default value is sqrt(eps) for forward finite differences, and eps^(1/3) for central finite differences
The default value is problem dependent:\n• Integer-constrained: max(min(10*numberOfVariables,100),40)\n• Otherwise: 50 when numberOfVariables ≤ 5, else 200
